description: Borrowed from Late Latin alleviatus, past participle of alleviāre (“to lighten; to alleviate”)

verbs.description: alleviate (third-person singular simple present alleviates, present participle alleviating, simple past and past participle alleviated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To reduce or lessen the severity of a pain or difficulty .
examples: Synonyms: address, allay, ameliorate, assuage, ease, mitigate, quell, relieve
Alcohol is often a cheap tool to alleviate the stress of a hard day.
